Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Angela P
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with our stay. The room, in my opinion, was decorated nicely. I loved the vintage desk, end tables and chandelier. It caused a cool effect on the walls. Basic cable and decent internet. The bathroom was very clean. Very hot water. We're from Florida, so it was a little cold for our blood. We had to call the front desk to ask if the heater was on when we got back to our room after a full day of sightseeing. They said it was central heat and would check on it. A little while later we could hear the sputter from the furnace. Didn't have a problem the rest of our trip. Very friendly service. The bed was on the very firm side, but the linens were clean and the pillows comfortable. Overall, it was a great stay for my first time in NYC. Thanks. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wcgmd
Reviews.Content: We knew the hotel was undergoing renovations at their lobby area so we were looking for the Seton sign and found it after a short walk from the Grand Central drop off by the Airporter from JFK. Check in was a breeze and we got to the 6th floor where the room was surprsingly tastefully done. Wish it was a tad bigger but everything we needed was there. The bathroom was 2/3rds the size of the room with a bath tub! The elevator was a bit slow and real small but never had a problem with not being able to get on it everytime. Love the free coffee, hot chocolate machine down the reception area. Friendly staff. We stayed 2 nights and the location was just great especially since we take the subway a lot. Lots of restaurants around the area. While going down the elevator one time, stopped at a floor where renovations were ongoing. The guy who joined us was the designer and we complimented on how beautiful the rooms were. He said the lobby area will have black slate and will definitely be awesome. I can't wait till we go back next year to see the finished work.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't plan on being there much”
Reviews.Author: CH4TC
Reviews.Content: The room my partner and i stayed in was very very basic! Dont get me wrong we had a fabulous holiday. Fortunately we didn't spend much time in the hotel so it didn't bother us too much. On our first night at the hotel we were a bit jet lagged, and in 12am US time our room telephone rang waking us both up from our much needed sleep, with an angry reception man on the phone accusing us of throwing water out of our bedroom window!! We were fast asleep! I told him we had not thrown water out of the window and he accused further saying someone had seen us doing it! Madness, so this ruined our sleep pattern completely. Good location though and other staff all seemed quite friendly, we had a brilliant time in NYC despite the problem with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lack of a culture of service”
Reviews.Author: Bruce C
Reviews.Content: This is a small midtown hotel undergoing renovation. We had a small but rehabbed room at the end of a long hall. However, if you need internet access (I have an internet intensive business) however, do not stop here. They don't have it. When only able to get an ultra weak 1 megBp signal in the room, I asked at the desk if they would print a 16 page PDF file for me and fax it as an alternate. The desk clerk, who never identified himself to me, pointed me out the door and said "you need a business center for that. Internet is provided as a courtesy". I lit out to Starbucks and send my necessary file just prior to business close. When I returned I tried to re-engage him as I now had the luxury of time. His comment: "you behavior was inappropriate". WRONG. THINK AGAIN. Try competing in midtown without internet. Internet was de-facto unavailable. Never mind that the hotel maintainence staff earlier, even tried to move the cisco router down on the wall so that the antennas would stand upright to optimize signal. I went downstairs to the lobby at 11:45 PM to respond to the last emails of the day and I could hear the same clerk/owner/whatever saying "he was upset earlier today". I sure am. With that sort of culture of service, I will never be back. I think it would have required about four minutes to fix my problem and get the file to destination.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Richspot60
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Saint Paddys weekend. Had a newly remodeled room and it was great. Some friends visited from Holiday Inn express on 45th and couldn't believe the size of our room compared to theirs. Much larger and half the price. Room was clean and service was good. Decent beds with 4 huge pillows. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location...even better when renovations finished!”
Reviews.Author: BigBrownEyes179
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seton last week for 4 nights, as everyone says it's a great location, With a great team, namely Amanda, Alicia and CJ who were friendly, fun and helpful. Pluses : renovated rooms are nicely done and have very comfortable beds, free wifi,nice bathrooms. Minuses: the journey from reception to the 4th floor and above...( you are literally walking through a dusty building site, which you adjust to after the initial surprise) the lack of coffee/ tea making facilities in the bedrooms. Would we stay again? Yes, and hopefully the building work will be finished by then.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: shellywelly718
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our trip to NYC december 2011. we booked through a booking site and this hotel had the best value rooms in a good area. our bedroom was lovely, really nice, very clean and comfortable. The hotel was situated in a great central area, easy walking distance to times sq. staff were friendly and happy to help. Free wi-fi is a bonus and there was an unlimited supply of free tea/coffee in the lounge area. will definitley recommend this hotel to friends and family. wonderful chinese restaurant near here, but cant remember what it is called!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lagallagher80
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel over the new year period, have to say i was a little worried with regard to the reviews but decided to take the chance. After being dropped at the wrong hotel (the Senton - dont make the same mistake) we were overjoyed with this hotel.......definately stay in the renovated rooms, spotless, cleaned every day, i honestly could not fault the hotel. Staff very friendly and was presently surprised to hear an irish accent coming from reception. Excellent location, you are a stone throw away from everything, felt a very safe area also. For my Irish brethren, Peter Dillons pub is practically next door which is great for a few small ones after a day of walking and walking and walking and walking and............. planning a visit again later this year - and will not even bother looking at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable and clean hotel in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: franciscomorales
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC a lot of work sometimes on long stays sometimes on short stays. Seton Hotel is perfect and has gone thru great changes in the years I have been using them. They offer several types of rooms with great price options. Times where I will only be in NYC one night their single room with a shared bathroom is a great deal. Those of you who have traveled in Europe know what a shared bathroom is like and these people keep them spotless. Longer stays I usually get their newly remodeled room. These rooms are great, clean and very comfortable. I have several videos and photos from the rooms I have stayed in and I'm happy to share them. In January alone I have stayed with them 3 times already. The only problem I had was loud construction next door but that's not something the hotel can control.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_AAustralia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the seton with my partner for the new year period. We arrived at the hotel and when we got to reception the person who checked us in had no idea about our reservation that we had made in May was very unsure and didn't seem to know what he was doing. We were given a room with a "double bed" I used this term loosely as the bed was not even a king single. I do not know how they expected 2 fully grown adults to sleep in this bed my partner is 6ft tall and from his shins downward hung out the bed ( thank goodness I'm short) the bed every time you moved the bed board would bang against the wall and wake you up. Not to mention our lovely view of a brickwall out the window and the construction workers beginning their work at the crack of dawn. We were given an unrenivated room the hall ways to the room were there were disgusting holes in the walls, dirty carpet and dirty walls. We spent one night in this room and I had to speak with reception because it was just impossible for us to fit in this bed for a further 5 nights. We were helped out by Alicia who was lovely and I couldn't fault her she was more than willing to help us move rooms. We had to pay 120 US dollars to upgrade to a renovated room but it was worth it as we went up the the next room which was on the 4th floor it was like stepping into a new world in comparisson to the 3rd floor where we had come from. Everything was beautiful and clean and the bed was a decent size for two people. The reason I marked this hotel low is the beginning was awful and after already forking out quite alot of money to stay here we still had to pay additional money to get a bed that we fit in and besides Alicia who was great the other staff appeared clueless and were unhelpful to us. The other positive is that it is in a great central location and you can get just about anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reliable - a fantastic stay! Will be returning!”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr90
Reviews.Content: First of all, 2.0 as an overall rating is completely unfair for this hotel. We stayed two weeks prior to Christmas this year in an unrenovated Queen room with a refurbished bathroom (on the 3rd floor) - it was clean and spotless, everything was in good working order – bedroom and bathroom were rather spacious by standards. Housekeeping gave us loads of towels and they are changed every day. The heating in the room was nice and hot when it came on - you can't control it though, so it must be automated below a certain temperature. The bed was firm, comfortable and totally clean. Plenty of furniture to store stuff in, few more hangers wouldn't have gone a miss, I'm sure reception would probably supply if asked - we requested and were supplied with a fridge and hairdryer for our stay. The staff are lovely – very friendly and always there to greet you with a smile no matter what time of day. The hotel lounge is warm and inviting – the complimentary hot drink supplies were a bonus and be sure to check out the reading material available. The corridors and general fascia of the hotel are OLD - but it gives character, we actually preferred it to a more modern looking place. If you get hung up on little superficial things (or perhaps you’re in your hotel room for too long in NYC?!) then maybe you shouldn't stay here. We stayed for two weeks and it was a pleasure coming home to this hotel each night. You will massively appreciate the location when you stay here – so many cafes, bars, coffee shops and much more on your doorstep. Not to mention grand central station being less than 5 mins walk away! We also managed to easily walk to places such as times square and rockefeller center within 20 minutes or less. Taking all things into account, this is an ideal, clean and friendly hotel and really is a gem - we will certainly be coming back here!! Adam and Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a gem”
Reviews.Author: sandgropers2
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the Foyer and the halls. This hotel is being renovated from the Bathrooms out. They had just finished the sitting room when we were there, where you could sit with a tea, coffee or hot chocolate and browse their library or watch the big screen TV. Its a lovely old building which is within walking distance to all the major attractions and close to bus stops, Grand Central Station and taxis to get to the rest. We walked our legs off but with the city set out in a grid you never really get lost. Lovely staff, and a very nice Italian restaurant a few doors away we were set. I would highly recommend. This was also our first trip to NYC and we would return to the Seton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: daisy620
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to NYC and you couldn't beat the price or location of this place. We stayed in a renovated room with private bath and it was perfect for me and my husband. Great dining on the same block along with a fantastic pub within 20 ft. Would definitely stay again! If you don't need a lobby or alot of amenities this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Aimee H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYC for 7 nights at the Seton- the location is fantastic (5 min walk to Grand Central station) & close walk to Times Square, Byrant Park & Crysler building, For the cost of the rooms per night you do get your money worth, ensure you get a refurbished room. They are clean, neat & small rooms. One downfall of the hotel is you do not have control of the temperature of the room- they have oil heaters & reception can either turn heating on or off. At times this was very uncomfortable & we had to sleep with the window open as it was so hot in the small rooms. However, you are in NYC & never in your room as there is so much to see & do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for the budget minded”
Reviews.Author: btaccess
Reviews.Content: When i first read the reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor i was a little apprehensive as to what to expect having booked a double double with shared bathroom. I contacted the hotel when they were doing a deal for the newly renovated room and got an upgrade for $20. On Arrival the girl at the front desk (Aleisha) greated us with a warm smile and welcome and promptly checked us in. The elevator to the 4th floor was a little slow but was fine nonetheless. When we got to the room i was amazed at how spacious it was. there was enough room to walk comfortably around the bed and a good 10 ft from the bottom of the bed to the wall. The attached bathroom had a bath, sink and toilet, all finished to a high standard. Beds were changed daily with fresh linen and towels. Whilst the room itself didnt have a good view (403) it more than made up for it with the beds. The free hot drinks machine was wonderful and the information stand in the 1st floor lounge was full of useful and up to date info. The highlight to staying at this wonderfully located hotel is the staff. They are a credit to the hotel and will definately see my custom again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: Bearpat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently being refurbished and on first appearances doesn't look worth parting with your hard earned cash to stay in. However, appearances can be deceiving and having stayed in a refurbished room for four nights in September this hotel is as good as any. The room itself was a good size, with modern furniture, comfortable double bed and clean compact bathroom for which we were given ample clean towels each day. The lobby is slightly off putting as it hasn't been retouched by the decorators as yet but don't be put off by it. The staff were all friendly and helpful. There's a room just off the lobby which was very helpful as a location for meeting up with the rest of our group. It contains a table and chairs, tv and tea/coffee machine. Good location and we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: michele v
Reviews.Content: Myself and the mrs stopped in one of recently renovated rooms on the 6th floor. Very clean and tidy and fresh. Bit pokey, but if your anything like us we dnt spend much time in the hotel anyway, just to sleep. Staff were very helpful and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. Location was perfect, very short walk to most places, hence the reason why we got to see so much in so little time. Would 100% recommend to stop here, if i ever come back it's where im stopping. Thanks for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Skirby01
Reviews.Content: The old adage stays true in the case of this hotel. The location is fantastic... a short walk from Times Square and other points of interest (VERY close to Grand Central Station and the UN). We stayed in a room that hadn't been renovated, so naturally my expectations should be low. We had paid for a room with a private bathroom... what we got; a room with a tiny room to the side with a toilet in it--this room was so small, there was maybe a foot in front of the toilet at the most.. it was a little ridiculous. The sink itself was in our bedroom with the towels etc (obviously the toilet room was too small for the sink).. we had a shower but this was just in the bedroom (with a shower curtain being the only thing between the shower and the bed)... you may want to bring your own pillow to this place as the one that you get is very skinny! Aside from these little issues, our room was fine and I'm sure that these issues will be rectified when the room is renovated... although when the listing says "Courtyard view"; it actually means view of a brick wall... which is ok... it's NYC. As soon as you walk into the hotel, first of all the lobby is pretty old fashioned, but then you walk into the hallway to goto your room, and that took everything to a new level. The hallways were in pretty rough shape and there were huge holes in the walls around the electrical panel.. a little sketchy. I felt pretty dirty touching anything in the hallways.. again, once this is renovated and cleaned up, all of these errors will be fixed. The service at the hotel was quite good. Everyone was very friendly. As for now, you get what you pay for.. in the future, I think that this hotel will be a great spot to visit (once the renos are complete).... and the hot chocolate on the lobby level is dynamite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: NJA_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good location, about a block away from Grand Central Station. So getting anywhere by the Subway or by foot is not a problem.  Upon arrival at the hotel, you walk into to a small reception area. The staff booking us in were extremely friendly and seemed appreciative of your custom.  The room that we had was on the fourth floor and had recently been redecorated. The room was a good size in comparison to other rooms I have stayed in, in New York.  The room was very clean and the towels were changed on a daily basis.  As we were travelling on a budget the room we had was with a shared bathroom. I wasn't sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised.  The bathroom was always clean and there was never a queue.  Whilst staying in New York, we had a freak snow storm, which brought most of the North East to a standstill. We were due to be travelling to Connecticut, the hotel Staff went out of their way to find out if the roads were open and if the hotel that we were going to had power and heating.  Would recommend the hotel and would looking at booking the same hotel next time I'm in New York. What people have to remember is that this a budget hotel and not a 5* hotel. For the money that I paid to stay here I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a base & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Joys
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more like a posh hostel, we had an on suite but each facility were in little cubby holes around the room not very private glad I was with my hubby! However it was clean and comfy with heating and plenty of hot water and a perfect base for exploring the city. The staff were excellent very helpful & polite. There is free coffee in the lounge & free wifi in the rooms. Great value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Cheiranthus
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to Maurice and his staff for making our first stay in New York so very comfortable. The hotel is in a wonderful location if you enjoy walking the streets of Manhattan, and very conveniently located in relation to a lot of the major attractions (Broadway, Times Square, Grand Central, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center etc). We booked a renovated room with queen size bed and private bathroom (stayed in room 402) and it was immaculate. It felt as though it had only just been renovated and had been beautifully done up. The bathroom was very nice and the bed comfortable. Only slight drawback was that the room was on to the street, but I had brought ear plugs and slept very well. Housekeeping and front desk staff were very helpful (extra blanket,hairdryer and umbrellas). The entrance and lobby are unprepossessing, but didn't put me off at all. Coming from Newark airport there is a shuttle bus which goes to 41st Street, just a block away from the hotel and the round trip is only $27 per person. Our flights out of Newark were canceled so we went back for an additional night. Stayed in room 501, a renovated room with double bed and shared bathroom (sink in room) and this was fine also. It was only for the night, so space and bathroom not much of an issue. The shared bathrooms on this floor were pristine! All in all a good choice for us, would definitely consider staying there on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, warm welcome, "you get what you pay for"”
Reviews.Author: LH1171
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Seton at the end of a week touring New England. We only wanted a clean, quiet bed for a few hours sleep, a clean bathroom + somewhere to store luggage all day before returning to airport for a night flight - this is exactly what we got at the Seton + no more. As we truly only wanted the above we booked a basic room - the corridors on floor 2 are unrefurbished and VERY grotty + you wonder what you have come to, however, it is clean! The shared bathrooms, again old + unrefurbished but very clean. The bedroom, old, threadbare carpet but the bed appeared new and spotlessly clean - what we wanted! Our room was at the back of the hotel and you would never have known you were in the middle of New York, we slept soundly when we finally fell into bed in the early hours after savouring the nightime atmosphere of Times Square that is only a few minutes walk away. Being only 2 minutes walk from Grand Central Station it was easy to grab our suitcases from the Seton and hop on the airport shuttle bus having grabbed a free hot chocolate from the hotel lounge while re-packing our suitcases with our NY shopping. So, be aware of which type of room you are booking but if on a budget, this hotel has that important location, location, location at a reasonable price and the staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. One thing tho, I wouldnt recommend the lower floor shared bathroom rooms to women travelling on their own - as the corridors are very narrow and uninviting, I wouldn't have felt comfortable if I wasnt with my husband (although we didnt see another guest on our floor during the very short time we were there).

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kopingmad
Reviews.Content: A great location with easy walking distance of 42nd street and Grand Central Station for subway or bus. Some good local stores for food and drinks. We stayed on the 5th floor. Room was a good size with new towels and bed made up each day. The two shared bathrooms were clean and tidy. We were able to leave our luggage with reception on the morning of our flight and collect later. Staff very friendly. Free Wifi was a big plus when working. The only bad things were the one small slow lift (for 4/5 people), the bedroom floor wasn't cleaned well enough and hot water for drinks required a trip to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Seton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricSchneider
Reviews.Content: The renovated, upgraded new rooms with private bath at the Seton are fabulous and very much a bargain in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION,CLEAN AND INEXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Gees_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the UN General Assembly. Hotel rooms in NY were outrageosly expensive during this week. The Seton rates however were really inviting. After reading reviews an looking at pics on TA. I took a gamble and booked a double double and a queen renovated room.Both with private bathrooms. It was a bit of a worry as as my family and friends we were travelling with are extremely fussy. We arrived and first impressions were disastrous as we did not know whether to laugh or cry when we saw the tiny little entry and the hole in the wall were the reception was. No more than 2 or 3 people could stand in the entry at any given moment. Sqeezed into the tiny lift and headed to our room. To our amazement the double double room was large, tastefully decorated and very clean. I did not see the queen room but I believe it was the same only very small. We were all very happy with the choice especially the ladies as they had more money for shopping with the savings made on the hotel choice. Staff were very friendly especially Alicia. ALL WE NEEDED WAS SOMEWHERE CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE TO SLEEP AND THE RENOVATED ROOMS DID JUST THAT.

Reviews.Title: “Good position.”
Reviews.Author: skapskap
Reviews.Content: Seaton hotel is in a good position. Close to the Grand Central and only 5 minutes away from TImes square. They recently had a renovations and some rooms (more expensive) seems to be cool. The old rooms are ok. Nothing fancy but comparing NY standards, they are ok. It is ok if you dont spend too many nights there. People who works there friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: KLM40
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just returned from NYC. We needed a hotel for only one night, nothing fancy, just to sleep for a couple of hours. We searched for an inexpensive hotel (under $300) on many websites. Most inexpensive hotels have a shared bathroom, which is a deal breaker. Not the Seton Hotel, they do have nice-sized private bathrooms. We didn't know what to expect, but the hotel was great and our room was perfect. Our room was newly renovated and the bed was comfortable. We found the hotel on google maps, so we knew what to look for. We arrived at 6:30 a.m. and, of course, the rooms wasn't ready. The hotel staff let us freshen up in one of the bathrooms and held our bags at the front desk all day and night until we checked-in. All three staff that we met were very nice and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located on East 40th St, near Fifth Avenue and two blocks from Grand Central Station. We felt safe walking on the side streets, looking for places to hang out. I would def recommend this hotel for a weekend getaway! We were pleasantly suprised!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner stayed 4 nights. I was a bit apprehensive after reading previous reviews, but found the renovated rooms excellent. I wasn't too sure about the shared bathroom, but it was always clean and always available and very modern! Reception staff are excellent, helpful and a bit of craic! I would recommend, good value for money, WIFI and a bit quirky! (note some of the hallways and entrance are still 'old', but the rooms are done up already)

Reviews.Title: “Rough outside, but remodeled rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: carlosfpardo
Reviews.Content: Please note: this is a review of a remodeled room - not at all about the original rooms which would have a rating of 0! So the place is being remodeled, and the rooms of the upper floors are pretty new and clean, and spacious. The price is ok for Manhattan but pretty high if you evaluate the place completely. Bad stufd is that there is no breakfast at all - just machine coffee which was absolutely horrible. But it's really near everything in midtown and tons of subway lines at Grand Central. So in the end it's fine, but please do reservations in the upper rooms which have been remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ariel I
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights during september and everything was very well. The room, one of the new ones, was very comfortable, with natural light, not noisy. The staff, all of them were very kind and friendly, the received some packages for me, and they keep it on excellent conditions. The Location, just two block away from Gran Central Station is perfect, near the subways, very safe area, full of places to have breakfast, went to a different one every day. If you are looking for a place to stay in NY consider Seton, you won't regret!!

Reviews.Title: “If the elevator was fast, this place would be perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye582
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, comfortable, excellent location, great staff, great value. The elevator is from the 1920's , but if you can deal with that, this place is ideal for a NY traveler on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RobBrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, and to be honest I thought the hotel was excellent, it’s by no means a luxury hotel, and I have stayed in better, however it does what it says on the tin, it is a budget hotel, we stayed in one of the un-renovated rooms, it kind of reminded me of the old British seaside hotel rooms, the beds were comfy, it had a shower and a toilet and it was clean! There is lift to all floors which works, free Wi-Fi that worked Free, tea, coffee, and drinking chocolate. The one thing this hotel has over many of it’s other over priced competitors is location, East 40th is quite quiet (for Manhattan) so no problems with traffic, but the real bonus is it is only around the corner from Grand Central Station, we were in Times Square most nights. The area it’s self is not too bad, lots of bars, restaurants and fast food joints, something for everyone (in every price range) A mention to the staff who were always friendly and knowledgeable. In short an excellent place to stay for a great price , don’t be put off by the negative feedback

Reviews.Title: “Nice - Convenient - Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Joey00
Reviews.Content: I liked this place. Did a 1-nighter thanks to Hurricane Irene. Private w/bath. Good sized bed, clean linen, smallest bathroom I’ve ever seen but all that really needed was the toilet and it was functioning. Shower was separate, clean and also functioning. Working tv & ac. Quiet. Friendly & helpful staff. Good price. Walking distance to everywhere I wanted to go. Smooth check-in & check-out. Plus I left an item and was able to call back and have it returned. A good choice. God willing - I’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a non-fussy business traveller”
Reviews.Author: JoyceT2612
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance to UN and reasonably priced in terms of NY rates. The early check in I had requested was met at no extra cost. Due to some renovations and refurbishments, the room was airy and fresh although like most NY hotels in this category, the rooms are small which is fine for a business traveller who spends minimal time in the room. I hope the lobby and reception will also undergo serious refurbishment as they are in dire need of such.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: warice
Reviews.Content: 5-10 mins walk from grand central station so very well located.close to central park,empire state building.central location-easy to go up town and down on foot if desired. we reserved a room with private bathroom-clean with flat screen lcd tv,air conditioning.Great value for money.24 hr deli only 2 mins away useful if arriving in early hours of morning.This is not the Hilton so if your trying to impress someone go elsewhere.But for value,location,cleanliness it is fantastic.it also has free wifi. You can get here by airport shuttles:NYC aiporter they only charge $15.50 one way or $29.50 return.Taxi from JFK is $51.00 plus tips... one way.they have free wifi on the shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: catsanova
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I stayed for one night and for me I was glad it was only 1 night. I had heard some of the rooms had been renovated but not ours. The ceiling was water stained and it was just generally kinda creepy. The bath was super tiny but at least we did not have to share a bath! It was clean enough but I slept on top of the sheets. It was fine to flop for the night and I was there only about 8 hours, but not a repeat for me.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel of Two Halves”
Reviews.Author: Janmat
Reviews.Content: Saw many mixed reviews before we went, but really only needed a bed to sleep in. A pleasant welcome greeted us on arrival. On going to our first room (we booked an unrenovated room) the air conditioning was not working, my husband went ot the front desk and they moved us to another room immediatley. The unrenovated rooms were not the best I have stayed in but we made the choice to give it a go. They were clean and fresh towels supplied each day but would remind you of student days when you had to slum it. Never had a problem getting in or using the shared bathroom but no door hook to hang your clothes and no mirror. However we came back to our room one day and our luggage rack had been removed we were living out our cases as the small cupboard smelt musty. I went to the front desk to complain and had a very apologetic manager who brought one up to us immediatley. We chatted and he showed us around the renovated part of the hotel, which is lovely the rooms finished to a high standard, he has started at the top and is working down. We then upgraded to a renovated room for a greatly reduced rate than if we had booked one in the first place. We also came back to the room the second night and a complimentory bottle of wine had been put in our room along with a mini fridge. The manager also told us that he was at present struggling to promote the hotel due to the big divide. my only gripe on the new rooms is that they lack any safe boxes. The lift up to the room was also very hot and had no air conditioning. His plans are to renovate the front lobby area next then to carry of with the rest of the rooms. He also advised us to contact the hotel direct if we ever planned to return for a more favourable rate! My advice would be that if you want a trip down memory lane to youor student days then a budget room will do however the renovated rooms are worth the extra. The location is great and ideal for all ammeniaties. The people on the front desk was all polite and answered all queries they also ordered our black taxi for our trip to the airport and did not charge for this

Reviews.Title: “Very central and reasonably priced for the area”
Reviews.Author: helen_and_gareth
Reviews.Content: The entrance to this hotel does not do it justice and you should not be put off by the reception area. It is about 2 minutes from Grand Central Station and excellantly situated as a base to explore New York. We had an en-suite recently re furbiushed room and found it clean, spacious, nice looking and functional. We found the free wi-fi useful (when we could get a signal) and the staff helpful. We had both a bath and shower and there were drinks facilities avaibale in a communal area downstairs (a free coffee/ tea/ hot chocolate machine). We had no problems with noise/ level of hygine or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!”
Reviews.Author: LucasK
Reviews.Content: We paid $260 per night to stay at this property for four nights. Super high prices seem to be the norm in NYC, in Melbourne AUS you would get 5 star Hilton for this price with amazing city views. In NYC we got a 5th floor room, facing a brick wall, no iron or ironing board, no guest services book (no idea how to dial reception on the phone), the room was renovated as was the general floor, avoid floors 1 - 3 which look somewhat bleak. Location excellent with walking distance to Grand Central Station, Times Square & Fifth Avenue. Lots of great places to eat near by. The hotel did it's job, reception was literally a tiny waiting area, very basic, felt slightly ripped off for the price, but again, must be the norm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Seton Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alisonalisonalison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seton Hotel for five nights in May and had an excellent stay. My husband and I were both very impressed with the hotel, especially the quality for the price we paid. We were on floor 5 and the room was impeccably clean and very modern. The shared bathroom down the hall was always spotless and really nice and we never had to wait. It's a lovely one-person private bathroom, and it's really just a few steps away. The location is superb; the hotel is right below the Chrysler Building at Lexington and 40th St and two blocks from Grand Central, so it's easy to get around. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. We booked through the hotel's website, where you can choose a refurbished room or not (with an appropriate price difference). Also, the hotel's website had the best price I could find, and it was good to know what sort of room I'd be getting. We stored our luggage there on the morning we arrived, which was fantastic and free. The only thing I would pass along to people considering this hotel is that the rooms are a bit small. It didn't bother me because we were hardly there, but if you have a lot of luggage or need a lot of space, you may find it a bit tight. I think this is probably the best accommodation deal in Manhattan! I cannot say how impressed I was, considering what a hotel room in Manhattan tends to cost. Don't hesitate to stay here (though it sounds like you'd want a renovated room!). I have no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very basic old hotel”
Reviews.Author: florentia86
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, close to Grand Central and other places in Manhattan. However, the hotel itself is very basic, shared bathroom looks really old and not so nice to shower at.

Reviews.Title: “half the hotel is a 5* the other is a 1*”
Reviews.Author: wolvesfc1982
Reviews.Content: We booked a week in NYC (second time weve been) and booked a package through Expedia. Our options prior to going were either a private or shared bathroom, we had no option on a new or old room. We got to hotel and were given room on the second floor, the corridor leading to our room was the same as floor 1 and 3.... very poor. Seriously its was awful. As for the room, well it is the worst room ive ever been in, the room i stayed in at a hostel with 20 other blokes was the Hlton compared. The bathroom wa small, seemed dirty all the walls were yellow the decor ancient and dust everywhere. I was gutted. I had heard on this site that the rooms at the top (4,5,6) were nice so i went to desk to complain, i was told that we had paid a very low rate (we did in fairness) for our room so therefore we had a low rate room. In sort we paid extra for a nicer room (best thing i ever did). As i got to my new room (6th floor) i couldnt believe the difference, clean, modern, bright absoloutley faultless. We had a shared bthroom compared to a private one, but for the extra it costs for a private one have a shared, they are clean and modern and unless its busy time of year chances are you may be only sharing with a few people. We were really pleased and happy to pay the extra. There is a lounge on floor 1 near to reception desk which does complimentary coffe which was nice, reception area is small but staff very helpful. From my experience maurice and Amanda were really good at their job on the desk but all the others were good too. Rooms cleaned every day, one morning we stayed i bed so put the o not disturb sign up and they didnt and came back that afternoon to clean which was very good. Maurice advised me to book rooms from their site next time as you can choose whether to have a renovated room or not. Location is excellent, 40th street near Grand central and walking distnace to everything you need, i recommend getting a tube ticket for the week excellent value. I will definatley stay here again as long as its floor 4 5 or 6 i wouldnt stay on the other floors if you paid me. If u book a package deal, chances are youll be in a poor room so if ur looking to book, do it through the site

Reviews.Title: “Decent little hotel in a fab location, perfect for NY sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ln4t
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel (after some trepidation on my part!) and decided to go for one of the newly renovated rooms, following some scare stories on tripadvisor. When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised, the staff we very friendly and informed us we'd been booked into their best new room (they were clearly very proud of the refurb). The room was comfortable and clean, all be it there was a few complications with the heating! The location of the Seton hotel is perfect, just one block away from Grand Central station which has great subway connections to the rest of manhatten. All in all, this hotel is a bargain for its location in comparison to other midtown NY hotels! Highly recommended for the traveller on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM”
Reviews.Author: hbic50
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested I try the Seton. Although the hotel is undergoing renovation, the new rooms are the best deal in town. These rooms are pristine and have a very European feel; both pretty and practical. It is also in a great location. Don't be put off by the lobby, be patient and you will be rewarded.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: SilviaMendoza_81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very central location, on 42nd Street near Grand Central Station and Times Square. The staff was friendly but the hotel facilities are horrific! The room we stayed in was old and no remodeling, that if I had bathroom inside the room. The toilet on the one hand, the bath and sink another elsewhere. We stayed at the hotel for 5 days and 4 nights. If you want a clean hotel with good facilities, this hotel is not what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous awful experience that ruined my holiday”
Reviews.Author: mellaanne1
Reviews.Content: Please avoid like the plague. I say this honestly as a traveller that does not require much only cleanliness and safety. I have stayed in numerous hostels and never complained. I booked as i heard the place was renovated but found out only top floors were and we were on a low floor. It was dirty, grubby and i would not walk of the carpet without shoes. no heating and we froze, bought a dressing gown and slept with that and cried from the cold tried to block the vent but the window were broke and cold was unbelieable. We would be in starbucks at 7.00 am to heat up. one shared toilet and bathroom that was occupied alot so you either held of tried to access another floor. some staff were unpleasant and no one would help with anything particularly on the day we left, our bags were heavy they would not even hold open the door least alone help. The catch of the day is adding on the tax after which is new. Before all was included in cost now watch for additional 14.75% and 3.50 per night tax which made the stay worse why did we stay in this hell. all i wanted to do was go home and they will only book their shuttle they get 6 dollar commission. it gauled me giving it to them. STAY AWAY FOR YOU OWN SAKE. i would have been happier sleeping on the street and trying to find your way out if there was a fire its next to near impossible. Fire hazzard, health hazzard and holiday hazzard. the last time i stay at the YMCA and it was half the cost and still a slight better standard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Newly Renovted Hotel In Midtown Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Travelman2187
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Seton hotel while traveling to tend to some business in New York. I was very impressed with the management of this property and the way that they conducted their business. Running a hotel cannot be an easy task especially when you are undergoing a renovation. I wanted to thank everyone who made my stay extremly enjoyable and to let you know I will be staying at the Seton whenever I come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aklingos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what I paid for it, it was great free wi-fi and free coffee and tea was a plus, the lounge was nice with good sun and all of the staff was really kind and helpful. It was great when checking out they allowed me to secure my bag in their bag room until my cab ( which the front desk staff was happily to call and book for me) arrived. I would gladly stay in this hotel again and recommend it to any traveler that isn't looking to spend much time in the room but out and about in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Location, Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jackieville555
Reviews.Content: The Seton hotel was great!! The staff was so nice, it was in a great location and my room was very clean!! The owner was very kind as well as Maurice and Amanda. When you walk in the hotel it looks a little iffy but the staff told me the whole building is being renovated floor by floor. I would for sure stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, clean, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: adfinvirginia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Seton Hotel for 3 nights and were very pleased with our choice. It was the best price for a decent, clean hotel within walking distance of Grand Central Station, Times Square, and the American Girl store! Staff was great in helping us find our way to various places and the room we stayed in was clean and recently renovated. We were very happy with our quaint little room and the savings!!! - which we spent on the fun stuff. Would do it all over again!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: franciscomorales
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor only let's me review once every 3 months. I stay here each month I go to NYC I have stayed in their old rooms and their new rooms. The location of this hotel is perfect 2 blocks away from Grand Central Terminal and minutes away from Time Square on the train. The rooms are always clean and the new rooms are well decorated. The staff is very friendly always willing to help and make it a good stay. Every time I show up seems like something new is being done to improve the hotel. The price for the room is well worth it and at the end of the night you know you will be getting the best value in the city. I look forward to staying with them and im actually planning on reserving their top floor suite for when I take my family.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague.”
Reviews.Author: Pingaps
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the hotel was still under renovation, so there were lots of workers moving up and down. We were given a very dowdy room and upon inspection, there was rubble that had fallen from the ceiling into the bedroom and bathroom. The manager refused to give me a refund and was extremely rude. After much quarelling she finally upgraded us to the newly renovated suite, which was definitely much better than the earlier room. There's no restaurant, only a small room with a tea/coffee machine. The rates are also quite dodgy. I ended paying more than I should have and even the taxi driver who was arranged by the hotel started fighting with us over the payment (he wanted more than what was previously determined). All in all one of the worst hotel experiences of my life. Please don't stay here unless you have really no other choice (but in NYC that's close to impossible). Only consolations were the pleasant bell boy and cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied !”
Reviews.Author: suzanno10
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights, was a little worried after all the reviews I had red here, but we had 2 rooms on the 6th floor and it was all renovated, brand new and very clean. Free wi-fi everywhere. Good value for what you pay.......but I don't know about the other floors.....

Reviews.Title: “VERY IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: judithsobe
Reviews.Content: I was in New York on vacation and stayed at the Seton Hotel. I was very Happy with the service and the staff. We got to stay in one of their updated rooms which was absolutely lovely. Being from South Beach we tend to be picky when choosing a hotel it was a very pleasant experience. Will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: holtie
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying at Seton Hotel based on a few reviews I read on Tripadvisor. As we pulled up to the hotel and entered the "lobby," I was still a little worried. The lobby area is really a hallway rather than a welcoming reception but within minutes, I knew I had nothing to worry about - my room was perfect. I was in one of the newly remodeled rooms and it was huge for NY standards. The decor was very nice and the bathroom was spotless. When we arrived we were greeted by the nicest hotel employee, Amanda. She went out of her way to assist with anything we needed. The hotel is in the process of making a number of changes so some things such as blow dryers, might not be in the room but the hotel is happy to provide one upon request. I've stayed in several NY hotels and sometimes noise can be a problem. Not so for us at the Seton Hotel and the window shade did a great job keeping out light. It was also great to have access to coffee/tea/hot chocolate 24/7. There were plenty of towels and soaps in the bathroom and good lighting in the room too. Did I mention the great location, and at a great price too!!! Seton Hotel is perfect for the budget traveler. As we checked out, we had the chance to meet the owner who was so gracious, thanking us for our stay and inviting us back. We are already planning our next trip and we know where we will be staying - Seton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a new beginning for Seton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barron759
Reviews.Content: The Seton Hall is in transition and you can expect great things once the property is completely renovated. The room I was fortunate enough to stay in was first class with chic room decor with all the basics covered. The room is well appointed and the bath is very nice. The roman shades covered the big picture windows which let in great light once I started working at the desk in the morning with their freely available wifi connection. The new bathroom with a beautiful pocket door, gorgeous tile work and clean glass shower area was special and more than just the basics. The hallway for my floor had not been renovated yet but I was able to tour a hallway that has been done and it was very nice, well lit and contemporary. Being on 40th street in the Murray Hill area is so convenient to everything New York has to offer. You can't go wrong with this location. My hat is off to ownership for making these changes.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, clean, decent room.”
Reviews.Author: kimmyellen86
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, this hotel is not luxury, but it serves the purpose well. My husband and I took a weekend trip to the city to see comedian Joel McHale (which was brilliant, by the way) and we just wanted a safe place to sleep at night that wouldn't put us seriously over budget. We got that at Seton. Plus, the entire staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. As we checked out, they even offered to let us leave our stuff there while we walked around. This hotel helped our trip go smoothly, and I will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura0878
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Seton Hotel last weekend and although I was a bit nervous after reading a lot of negative reviews but I found the hotel to be just fine for us (two twenty-somethings on a budget who didn't want to stay in a hostel). Our room had a queen bed with a private bath, the room was old but the sheets were clean and so was the bathroom. We were able to leave our luggage there after we checked out and the staff offered us a discount on our next visit. The Seton Hotel is in a great location and you can't beat price, we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the money”
Reviews.Author: burrlamb
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of so-so reviews of this hotel, but i needed a low cost hotel near Grand Central, and Seton Hotel fit the bill. I also checked the bed bug registry and saw that many higher end hotels were listed, but not the Seton Hotel, to my relief, given the epidemic in New York. i have to say i was nervous taking the hotel, as my partner is very particular about cleanliness, and there were many reports of smelly carpet and dirty rooms. To my relief, i found the Hotel to be clean (though the carpet in our room was a bit ancient) and the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The room was dark and on the ground floor, but we weren't in New York to lounge around in the hotel, we were here for a wedding and needed a place to sleep. Our room was quiet and the bed plenty fine. The bathroom was recently remodeled and clean. The concierge was very helpful in trying to find the venue we were supposed to go to, and eager to help. This is not a luxury hotel, and you shouldn't arrive with luxury expectations. For the money, this place was plenty fine and i would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL and SUPER shady”
Reviews.Author: nomi203
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seton for an overnight trip with friends to see a concert. We made the reservation for four people, and yet when we came back after the concert, we were told there would be an additional charge of $50 to get back into our room. The manager was extremely rude and refused to check that our reservation was, in fact, for four. Aside from that, the room was cramped, bathroom dirty and stained, and the nightstand shelf was broken. On top of all of this, with the additional fee, we could've stayed at the Marriott, which is a lot closer to Madison Square and waaaay nicer. will never make this mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Bed Bugs, Poor Attention”
Reviews.Author: CeliBear
Reviews.Content: We´ve made our check in on last oct/02, room 304. Our reservation was made and paid by internet a month ago. The first night the sheets and towels were dirty, and we ask reception to change it for clean ones...the next night we saw they didn´t changed anything, and when we took off the sheets from the bed, we noticed at least 12 HUGE bedbugs on the mattress. We talked again with the receptionist (Miguel) who gently offered another room (504) and told us he would notify the manager of the hotel to a discount because of the inconvenient (whe didn´t slept 2 nights: the first one because of the dirty and the hitch, the second because we saw the bedbugs and the dirty still was there and we have to move from room 304 to 504...). The next day, nobody told us about discounts or excuses. Decided to enjoy our trip, we asked for Louise, another receptionist, to book for us a guide tour; we paid her U$22, and she gave us a kind of receipt to pay the difference later, when we decided to take the bus - but she didn´t marked the amount on the receipt. As so, we couldn´t make the tour. As indicated at the tour agency (at Broadway), we asked Louise for the refund, and she was very rude, yelling and trowing the money (U$20,) at the reception window. By now, we expect a solution of the manager, Mrs Leslie Heskiaoff. The bedbugs it´s a plague at the USA, but whe decided for this hotel because at internet it´s listed as one hotel WITHOUT this kind of problem. And we paid a lot for it (U$901,22 exactly). I hope this warning improves the service at this hotel, alert future guest and help us with some compensation for all the problems we had.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know a Budget Hotel could be so nice”
Reviews.Author: DaRon50
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff to the on-site owner, I was treated like a valued guest. The room was newly renovated and decorated, with a flat screen TV and remote-control A/C. The bathroom was tiled and clean, with excellent water pressure. A friend walked me up to my room on my last night's stay and remarked that my room was larger and just as nice as the one he had stayed in at The Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmmn”
Reviews.Author: GRIFFYUK
Reviews.Content: From the outside I thought it looked ok but it got slowly got worse the further in I got. It is a bit of a dump if I am being honest and I would not stay there again, however I did feel safe and the staff were nice. It you are looking for comfort and luxury the Seton is not the place to stay but if you are looking for cheap accommodation in NYC its not too bad. I would recommend not to stay in one of the rooms at the front of the hotel as it is so loud, I asked to be moved to a room nearer the back and it was so much quieter. I did the shared bathroom option and I could get into the bathroom whenever I needed. They are clean but there were bits of damp patches on the ceiling and the floor was wet from time to time but the water was hot and the showers had some force to them. The beds are comfortable but they are very small.......and the rooms are small too. The double room we were given was, in my option, too small for a double and was more like a single. I suppose you do get what you pay for and we paid $149 a night for the shared b/room option which in NY is not too bad but saying that I would still not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY AND HORRIBLE!!! DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cats025
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed there for two nights. The room was disgusting. They claim the rooms are cleaned daily but I don't even think they vacuum the floor. They then charged me an extra 300$ claiming they found ash in my room. My friends and I are non smokers so when I called to argue the charge I was told that if they even suspect you were smoking they charge you. This is ridiculous because as I mentioned earlier the room was disgusting so the supposed ash they found was probably left from a previous guest. DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for students traveling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: cd103341
Reviews.Content: It's not the Plaza but it's better than a hostel. The location is great and the price can't be beat. Our room was small but had a bed, flat screen tv, roomy closet, and sink. We opted for "shared bathrooms" but if you've ever lived in a dorm it shouldn't bother you. We had no problems waiting for a toilet or shower. Also, surprisingly there was free wifi. Security could be better. The desk is staffed 24 hrs but they ask that you leave your room key with them when you leave the hotel. Upon returning we were not asked to show ID to retrieve our key. Also, when we left our luggage after checking out, we just put it in a room with no lock and when we came to retrieve it we just walked in without having to let anyone know. However, nothing was stolen and the neighborhood felt very safe. Ok for our purposes and would stay again if on a tight budget, but take caution.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic stay at The Seton Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gfordgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at The Seton Hotel in New York. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone on a budget looking for a centrally located hotel. The location is superb - walking distance from Times Square, The Empire State, Rockerfella Centre, Chrysler Building, etc. Also easy walking distance (a few minutes) from Grand Central station where you can get the subway to the rest of Manhattan and beyond. We went for this hotel as it was the cheapest hotel on Expedia at the time that was in a central location and had a private bathroom. They do have cheaper rooms with shared bathrooms but we wanted the privacy and convenience of a private bathroom. We did have a look inside the shared bathroom and it was fine and there was never a queue. The hotel is a budget hotel and you get what you pay for. The rooms may not be the most modern in their fixtures and fittings, but they were always clean, the bed was comfy and the shower was powerful - which are the main things we look for in a hotel! The staff were friendly and helpful; for example I asked for extra pillows and the loan of a hair dryer and they sent these up to my room quickly. There is free wireless internet throughout the hotel. They were having some trouble with the wireless in the rooms for some of the time we were there, but the staff were apologetic and trying to sort it out. The wireless always worked well on the ground floor and there is a lounge with free coffee etc where you can sit. i would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again. Remember though - you get what you pay for - so don't book/pay for a budget hotel and expect a palace!

Reviews.Title: “Pro-location Cons - almost everything else”
Reviews.Author: tl87
Reviews.Content: The location is great - round the corner to grand Central. My room had no toilet/shower as it was a shared bathroom booking. One toilet was ok but not very clean and not the most secure locking. The shower was ok but not the best and was a bit crap having to walk back to your room with wet hair. Room had a tv with some channels working but poor signal. Internet didn't connect. Yet another reason the hotel was one just for sleeping in. Staff were ok but some were abrupt. My view - pay a not extra for a hotel with private bathroom/cleaner rooms/general better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Horrendous Place”
Reviews.Author: protacal
Reviews.Content: Dirty not finshed room still had spackle on walls not even spackle just roughed bathroom ceiling dirty rugs tiny tiny bathroom tv didnt work shower leaked customer service was terrible very harsh people to deal with a bad experience do not go.

Reviews.Title: “Staff protected by bullet proof glass but no chain lock on guest room doors.”
Reviews.Author: FootTourist
Reviews.Content: Room door did not have ANY secondary means to secure from the inside. The chain for a old fashion chain lock was missing along with the sliding lock mechanism On the lock mechanism itself. Anyone with a pass key could enter and the means which the lock was attached seemed in my opinon to be easily foiled by anyone who gave it a swift kick. Shared bathrooms varied in cleanliness. One was fine, another appeared to have mold in the tile grout, and a third had a splintered door base. Distinct odor of smoke noted in this suposibly non smoking room. Elevator door edges was sealed with painters tape and the age suggested it was not because they intended to paint it anytime soon. Location was decent, staff OK and I was not expecting anything other than a safe and reasonably clean tired old room. Fact that a $2.00 door chain was not replaced yet they expended the energy/expense to chain the cheap alarm clock to the wall says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the Plaza and you'll be pleased”
Reviews.Author: TraveloverUSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a night and it did the job. We were upgraded, for free, to a room with a "bathroom" (A shower stall in the room). The ceilings were high and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The location of the hotel is fantastic, couldn't have been more convenient. The woman at the front desk was very helpful and there were no issues what-so-ever throughout our time there. If you need a less expensive place to stay, and don't fuss over aesthetics this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “lower your expectations and you'll be pleased”
Reviews.Author: zuke583
Reviews.Content: this is a place to stay if you don't plan on being in the room very much. two beds, a small desk and a tv. i wouldn't want to stay there if i had to use a shared bathroom. it's definitely out of date and you may not feel comfortable leaving valuables in the room. not modern in any aspect (except for the out of place flatscreen tv in the room). that being said, if you're looking for a place to crash at the end of a long night, this place will serve you well. also, the staff was very friendly and helpful. i'd recommend it as long as you understand that this is not a hotel in which you should spend time.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: CtPaddler
Reviews.Content: Room photos from web site do not match the actual room. The actual room was very scary looking. It is hard to describe. The shower was on one side and the toilet was on the other. Both looked like converted closets. The internet did work. The TV did work, but there was currently an issue with local channels. The breakfast was free, but was not very good. I opted for McDonald's down the street. If you need a cheap place to stay, it is ok. It is in a safe area of NY

Reviews.Title: “Close to Time Square”
Reviews.Author: KapoorPanvel
Reviews.Content: neat & tidey lienin , but need much more to be done . very small room , the complimentry tea & coffe very poor in taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kotik888
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for one night in a room with a shared bathroom. The room was pretty small, no surprise there. But it was clean and the shared bathroom was clean too. The only downside was that we had to wait 30 minutes to get into it in the morning, but other than that it was good. Overall, great value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This Is The Worst Hotel In The World!!!”
Reviews.Author: aaronthaoutsida
Reviews.Content: I just got off of the phone with the manager at this Hotel. I had to cancel my reservation because of the horrible snow storm on December 19th 2009. I was actually coming to NYC to see a Dj Mark Farina show at The Sullivan Room, but it was cancelled. The manager of this hotel was extremely rude and refused to give me any type of refund. He actually told me that he was going to charge me a penalty fee and he cursed at me and then hung up the phone on me!! This hotel has the worst customer service, that I have ever encountered!! Please don't support The Seton Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great budget stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetogotoplaces
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay somewhere on a budget and this was perfect. We got the queen room with a private bath. It was the way to go. When you are in New york who wants to hang out in their hotel the whole time anyways. It was clean. Yes it was outdated but it was cheap!!!!!! I spent weeks comparing places on the web and this was the best deal out there for the location. If you want somewhere affordable with a great location and an average room stay there, I would again.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty and with bugs....”
Reviews.Author: susse4
Reviews.Content: Though the location is great we would never come back. The room should be with a bathroom. Instead there was a toilet in a closet which could not close and a shower beside the bed with no light. Walls and floor were fallen apart. The carpet seemed dirty and with plenty of dust. I was bitten by bugs which was awful. I will NOT recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “PROBLEM FREE STAY....”
Reviews.Author: abbf-fan
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD POINTS: Bedding was comfortable & most importantly clean. Non allergic pillows which was great as I'm asthmatic Shower was fine (no light in shower unit) with plenty of hot water, Fresh Clean towels & Face cloth each day - Also free mini soap bars. Carpet in room was clean Breakfast had limited choice but was plentiful. Good quality Coffee available 24 hours as well as tea and Hot Chocolate. NEUTRAL POINTS: Room furniture was quite old - basic colour TV (who goes to New York to watch TV anyway) BAD POINTS: Hotel elevator was very small & SLOW. The carpets in corridors leading to rooms from elevator were absolutely FILTHY & in desperate need of replacing. also needs redecorating. Other remarks: Hotel Staff were polite at all times - Hotel is very close to Grand Central Station (3 - 5 mins walk) There are lots of nice bars and restaurants near by ranging from Fast Food to World Class Cuisine close by. Over all the Hotel is fine - If the owners should address the poor hallway carpets as it does not give a good first impression - Other reviews mention the receptionist being behind glass - this is true but no different than at a bank or theatre. TIP: check out the money off leaflets in the breakfast room rack There are money off coupons there! eg 10% at Macy's, Discounts at Circle line Cruises, Madam Tussards, Top Of The Rock, water Taxi, WTC Tribute Center and Resturants

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: TLJArkansas
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed was the clerk at the front desk was behind bullet proof glass and it didn't get better from there. The halls had layers and layers of paint before the last garish color trim. The bed was supposed to be queen size but was only full size and they had used a second sheet instead of a mattress pad. The ceiling was stained and had holes, furniture in the room was mismatched and very old. The bathroom had been remodeled and was the best thing about the hotel. The drapes on the windows didn't fit, were too long and were not strait on the rod. The air conditioner was mounted above the window and the only way to turn it on was to stand on the chair in the room. I will admit the room was clean and quiet. Light bulbs were missing in the old lamps. What bothered me most was there was not a smoke alarm in the room and there was no dead bolt on the room door only a lock on the handle. I know it was supposed to be a budget hotel but is was just awful. We checked out after the first night and moved to a nice hotel for $50 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Your stuff is not safe there!”
Reviews.Author: little_rappy
Reviews.Content: Recently I visited new york from CT I have grown up all my life comming and going out of that city I decided to take my girl friend on a getaway for her birthday I was looking for a fairly cheap hotel that was still nice and this was not the place. I went in and made a reservation just in case and asked them to see a room they gave me a key to room 206 i passed through the little hallway where you make the booking I had to go up an elevator that barley fit 3 people and searched for this room down hallways that made me nausus to walk on because they were so uneven I felt like I was in a bad horror movie, they were gross along with everything else in the place, when I finally found the room it turns out there was peoples luggage inside the room. They gave me the key to someone's room I could have taken all their stuff and just left but i did not of course I also saw some creepy critters and stains everywhere, the staff was very rude not that i would call one guy who barely spoke english behind a plexy glass window staff, I am a 22 year old male firefighter it does not take alot to please me, I work on an ambulance in a very large city in CT I have seen hotels rented for the hour cleaner then the Seton they wanted to charge me $166.00 for a room with a queen sized mattress I was able to get a deluxe room with a king bed at the belvedere on hotels.com for only $50 more i reccommened spending the few extra dollars for a safe clean Hotel that was free of critters, I would concider this hotel on a dirty motel level they cater to people not from the states who lets face it do not know any better

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: hransome
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the Seton, received a confirmation, got to the hotel and they did not have a room reserved for me. They did offer me a room with a shared bath (which was not requested), but I was not traveling alone, so that would not have been appropriate. I eventually had to search online for another hotel for about 1 hour and found one that I had to pay $100 more per night for. I contacted the management of the Seton and explained the incident and recieved a very nasty email reponse from the manager saying that if I had excepted the room with the shared bath that I would not have been on the street. What type of customer service is this? The hotel is not all that nice to begin with and I have stayed at better for less. And the photos of the hotel rooms are alittle decieveing.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied stay @ the Seton in NY City”
Reviews.Author: mywarriorswife
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an inexpensive way to stay in NY city within walking distance of most of the action this is the place. We are a family of 4, so we booked 1 'family room' (2 double beds & private washroom w/shower). There was only one hotel listed as cheaper in the same area but a reviewer mentioned theft from their hotel room so I opted for the Seton. We were offered a Military rate and quite frankly we were very satisfied we got a good bang for our buck! The hotel itself is certainly older (not quite as old as the city) but in a true NY way. Hotel desk clerks were very pleasent and informative. Room was clean - no smoke smells only noticed a slight 'granny's attic' musty smell. Linens were changed every day. Saw no bugs or creepy crawlers anywhere. Bathroom was clean and 4 bath towels were placed out every day All bathroom items worked fine. Only hint is to get Hot water we had to let the Hot water run 10-15 min before showering but then it was wonderfully hot. There was a small fridge and tiny coffee maker for snackers. TV had cable but limited chanels (maybe 20?). The best part was being within walking distance of practically everything (times square/grand central station/mood fabrics/bryant park/empire state bldg/rockefeller central/broadway). Every morning we had breakfast for 4 (Myself, a muffin type and 3 military men appetites) in various cafes & delies in the surrounding neighbor hood. We came on the train and walked from Penn Station to the Seton no problem. Only time we cabbed it was to the Statue of Liberty ($18.00 one way for all 4 of us). And then back from the Statue to FAO Schwartz ($25.00 one way for all 4 of us). We were trying to see a much as humanly possible of NYcity during our stay so we only were in the hotel from 11pm - 7am for sleep. Never had a safety issue either in the hotel or on the streets around it. Only missed internet but we did find several cafes with internet in the area so we could surf. We would stay at this hotel again as we are a Military family trying to see the world on a shoestring budget and would recommend it to anyone in the same situation. However, if you tend to be in your room as much as you are out of it and need lots of ammenities this may not be the place for you. We opted for here rather than the cheaper but newer hotels on the Jersey side because once you factor in the cab fare for 4 from the Jersey side to times square area you are adding +$120.00 to you daily NY vacation expenses.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel and service....ever!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJoeMiami
Reviews.Content: Here are the pros: great location, close to Grand Central station...cheap for NY Here are the cons: EVERYTHING ELSE! I booked this hotel b/c it was one of the cheapest hotels I could find that had a bathroom in NYC......but boy did I wish I could just go back in time and spend $40 more for something better. The first day of my stay, the bathroom light was not working and there was no hot water. I went downstairs to explain this to the owner and his response was...and I quote "OK". I was waiting for an apology but didn't get one...then I asked if it would be fixed in a few hours when I get back. His exact response was "I'll try". The customer service in this place was AWFUL. I know it's a budget hotel but it doesn't cost anything to be pleasant or at the very least couteous. Aside from the lack of customer service, the bathroom tile was filthy. I took a look at the shared bathroom across the hallway and that one was 10x cleaner. The bed sheets smelled old and moldy. Every thing in the hotel room was old. I am just grateful that there is so much to do in NYC that I only had to go back to the hotel room to sleep. This was without a doubt the worst hotel room I had ever stayed in.....I know it’s cheap and not everyone can afford a good hotel but noone should have to pay $150 a night like I did for a filthy room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and functional, Great location, not pretty”
Reviews.Author: gtv6capri
Reviews.Content: OK, I have a wife and 2 teenagers and am on the average salary, so 2 rooms in downtown New York was going to cost a heck of a lot of money. I found the Seton Hotel and got a family room (2 doubles) for about $150 per night. This is less than 1/2 of what 2 rooms would cost in the downtown area, so I booked it. The hotel is old, the furniture in the rooms mismatched and the carpet needed replacing in 1979. However, the location is great, a 10 minute walk to Times Square and a 15 minute walk to Madison Sq Garden. Lots of food places around to suit all tastes and budgets. Room has a fridge, TV, coffee machine and air con. Good closet space and fresh linen daily. Staff helpful ensuite worked fine. You could easily right the place off, it is no Hilton. If you want a hotel close to the action at a cheap price and all you want the room for is to crash at night, then you will be OK. If you want sleek and modern or to impress then keep looking. I was on a budget and on the go all day so it was fine for me Some people mention the safety aspect, I felt quite comfortable at all times, saw no dodgy guests, and the neighbourhood is fine.

Reviews.Title: “great great location, very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: oshoosho
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was really OK. The location is just PERFECT..it is in central Manhattan, very near from Grand Central Station and many many interesting places..the area around is full of restaurants and coffeeshops. As for the hotel, it is a very very old one, not so well maintained but for a 100 dollars in that location it is more than excellent. the room was clean, everyday bedsheets and towels were changed. The sheets were a little smelly-possibly because old not because dirty-. I. booked a room with a shared bathroom and shower. I was so scared of the idea..but actually the bathrooms and showers were very clean. At anytime you would find them in a very good condition-although again very old-. The guys at the reception were very helpful. My american friends could not believe me when they knew about the price of a room in such location. For an extra 25 dollars you can get a private bathroom and shower. I would definitely go back, unless I become very rich and manage to stay at the Sheraton:):):)

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but good value in fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Deanorob
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 day trip in New York. I was planning on spending as much time exploring as possible so just wanted somewhere cheap to crash out at night. The downside is the place needs modernising and the fittings etc are tatty so can be a bit of a shock when you first turn up. But the place is clean. The sheets and towels where changed every day.
