My bed was comfortable. I had a room with a double bed, an old tv ( a few basic channels) and fridge and also a basin. I chose to have a shared bathroom but I never had any problem getting in there. Always had hot water. The floor I was on was very quiet and I never was disturbed by any other guests. The location can not be beaten, just a five minute walk to Grand Central and the Chrysler Building. Easy access to the Subway. So if you want luxury or are planning on spending a lot of time in you hotel for a romantic holiday go somewhere else. But if you want the basics at a great price in a safe location then I would recommend the Seton.

Reviews.Title: “Holden Caulfield's "swanky" hotel”
Reviews.Author: EarlBoBearl
Reviews.Content: O.K., the only real reason we stayed at this hotel was because it was made famous in 1945 by J.D. Salinger. His troubled teen hero, Holden Caulfield pops into this hotel one cold December night to meet an old school chum and do some underage drinking in the (then) hotel's entertainment lounge "The Wicker Bar". So, the hotel is a part of literary history. Holden described it as "swanky" in 1945. It's a flea bag folks. If you're going to spend the money to visit NYC, you might as well treat yourself to a nice, clean hotel. Walk by, take a picture of the Seton Hotel, and keep goin' !.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place with an excellent rate”
Reviews.Author: jiq06
Reviews.Content: Seton Hotel is an excellent choice for staying in Manhattan. The rates are really low, taking into account that is New York. The hotel is very simple. No lobby, an elevator and rooms. That's all. Check in was really fast (you can pay cash or credit card) and check out was just a minute. The rooms (I stayed twice) are clean and good. I got a room with private shower. The staff changes towels and blankets all days. If you are on budget and don't care about luxury, I truly recommend this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: TomasDublin
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my girlfriend and i must say the room we stayed in was a disgrace i dont expect much just a clean basic room,but there was a smell of urine out of our room,the inside decor looked like it came straight from the film oliver twist the hotel is dilapetated its more like a hostel than a hotel,the carpet was at least 20 years old the bed sheets had stains in them,and there where some very odd looking people walking around the place some of whom looked like junkies i wouldnt reccomend this hole to anyone it realy is dump,it does have a 24 hour reception but they are not particularly helpfull the location is great too,but im sure there are many other hotels close by that would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ... not so great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: shoey1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights at this hotel, and overall we were pretty satisfied. Plus points: fantastic location -- E40th St in between 3rd and Lex Ave (five min away from Grand Central Station, Mid-town Manhattan) 24-hour friendly staff who didn't mind storing our bags free-of-charge for a few hours after we had checked out cheap --- if you class £80 / USD 160 inc tax per night as cheap. Believe me, you won't find too many cheaper deals than that for an en-suite room in as good a location clean bathroom and decent shower / bath with plenty of hot water clean negative points: cramped room, worn-out carpet, pillow-cases had holes in them tv barely worked and didn't have half of the channels you'd usually get in a hotel (not that we were in NYC to watch telly!)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap,Smelly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chetmel
Reviews.Content: Seton is on a great location. Reception is manned 24 hrs and they are helpful but the hotel have some problems. There is a constant 'smell' in the hallway. The bed was old and and made a lot of noises. There was a few weird guests. This hotel needs urgent renovations. The only thing which was working was Internet. If you have a better choice go for it over the Seton. Not recommended for families!

Reviews.Title: “Ave at best”
Reviews.Author: RozAus
Reviews.Content: In NYC you get what you pay for. You pay nothing by NYC standards so don't expect much. The hotel doesn't look like it has been updated ever. Reception staff are there 24 hours but not exactly helpful. They do lock the place up after dark which is good though. Sheets were changed each day but certainly were not high thread count. If you are with a family this is not the place as it has an uneasy about to get robbed feel for it. If you are looking to stay on the cheap and never leave valuables in the room then go for it. Oh, lock your door.

Reviews.Title: “The smell....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Izzybtizzy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this hotel, i was a bit apprehensive to so the least.....arrived easily from newark airport...the location is the main advantage of the seton...it's very central to everything.....go our room keys and found our room basic but adequate....bed sheets and pillow cases were clean...and celan towels daily....didn't particularly like walkin barefoot on the carpet....the bathroom which was shared was cleaned daily and there were no ques so no probs there......the only prob we had was that our bedroom had a really strong smell of gas....when i raised it at reception, the receptionist got on her walkie talkie immediatley to the maintenance staff but when we came back in the evenin it was just as bad....the a/c was workin but havin a fan on full blast didn't make any difference.....if u don't mind roughin it a bit the seton is fine...if ur lookin for somethin that's much more than a youth hotelly type place then i'd look elsewhere ....

Reviews.Title: “Scottish Travellers - Its ok!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTravellers18
Reviews.Content: We are just back from the Seton and after reading the reviews I can honestly say it is fine! We were a family from Scotland (all adults) who stayed for a long weekend. Our room was cleaned every day with new sheets and towels. It is a typical blackpool hotel. The staff were friendly and security was good. We were on the 6th floor and had our own bathrooms/shower. One day the shower was cold...not sure if it was the shower or us trying to work it. Apart from that it is a fine place to stay if you are touring New York. The location is FANTASTIC! you are in walking distance from almost everything in the city. Oh and if you like a drink their is a great wee Irish Bar next door, where the staff are friendly and the beer is good! I would stay at the Seton again no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: altruista6
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel in a favorable location and neighborhood. It is a shared bathroom hotel, although some rooms do have a private bathrooms. The staff was friendly and some one was always at the front desk. The bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist_Couple”
Reviews.Author: Tourist_Couple
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are not affilliated with any competition of this hotel.We are just ordinary people who travelling to NYC.Don't stay at the SETON! We expected basic facilities, but this is truly the worst hotel we have ever been to.1)The night we arrived we had to sleep on bare pillows because the hotel had failed to provide pillow cases 2)No toilet paper in the room 3) Filthy showers - we went and bought a bath mat and disinfectant to be able to use them 4) As the battery of the smoke alarm started going dead at 4 a.m., the alarm started beeping in 30 second intervals for the rest of the night. 5)My skin felt very itchy after leaving the hotel We checked out at 6 a.m. that morning. And you know what? A porter who struck me as very arrogant/aggressive told us we wouldn't get any compensation for the sleepless night, the filth, and the virtually nonexistent service. Only at the Seton. The location is great, and this could be a nice hotel under different management. As it is - You're better off investing $50 dollars more for a cleaner, friendlier place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hole!!”
Reviews.Author: to3yster
Reviews.Content: The room was on the first floor. Everything was very dirty: walls, shower floor, and carpet. Old mismatching furniture looked like it was collected at some garage sale. Stains everywhere. The door was loose even when locked. I've stayed at cheap hotels in NY (if you think that $140 per night is cheap..) that were quite decent. This place shall not be on the market - it is not a hotel, it's a dump. For this money, I feel cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: ACH081
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seton hotel for 9 nights. Excellent location. Had double room with shared facilities. Rooms appeared clean. Clean sheets daily. Shared facilities old, but bearable. Only major problem was half way through our stay, we had a mouse running around in our bed whilst we were watching television. Consequently saw another one running around the room. Hotel staff did not seem surprised, and it appears they have had problems in the past. They explained that exterminators had been hired previously, but it seems they may need to get them back! We subsequently changed rooms and did not encounter any other problems. Overall, the experience would have been pleasant, but this incident certainly tainted it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - really not bad amenities”
Reviews.Author: kit0110
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, and at first glance my room seemed to be dirty and stained. But then I realized that the sheets were clean, and the towels and sink are clean. The bath is right next door, and it's clean also. Nothing is pretty or fancy and it all looks old, but the location is great. It's only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station and if you're coming into Manhattan from Newark Airport, the Express bus drops you off at 41st and Lexington, so you just walk to the hotel. I had 2 suitcases and a carry-on and it was easy, which was a relief. I am staying in a single room shared bath on the 4th floor. It's very quiet, which is nice, since I've stayed in many noisy rooms in Manhattan. The air-conditioner in this room does not work, but it's cool enough not to matter - you might think twice mid-summer. There is a fan though. The shared bath is rarely busy so far. there is also a small fridge. Also, amazingly enough, I have wireless internet service in my room. I read another traveler review that said it was in the snack room - but found that it came on in my room. It's not a "hotel experience" kind of place - just a place to sleep, but a good buy in Manhattan for a single traveler - double room prices with a private bath are closer to what you can find elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “**Surprisingly Pleasant**”
Reviews.Author: IrishLass777
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were going to New York City for our first visit when one of my friends booked this hotel for us. I was horrified after reading the reviews of this hotel, and was worried to be staying in such a place with my daughter. Upon arrival, the staff wasn't the friendliest, but by no means wretched – they were always willing to help, and point us in the right direction. We stayed for six days. I believe our room was the one pictured. We had a private room with a bathroom. The room was older, but seemed to have been recently renovated. We had clean linens and towels daily. This hotel was not what we are accustomed to, but I was surprised it wasn't even close to being as horrible as other people have commented. Also, I am a single female traveler with a child and had no reservations about staying in this hotel as other people have commented about the hotel not being safe for females. We are getting ready for another trip to NYC and will be staying there again. *Advantages: - Affordable for extended vacations - In downtown (centrally located) - Nice area

Reviews.Title: “Why complain?”
Reviews.Author: mick46
Reviews.Content: We, a couple in the middle-40's, stayed 6 nights at Seton. Although the hotel and our room did appear in a rather bad condition overall - and the staff made us feel like we were interupting them when we left or picked up the key - the bed was large and suprisingly comfortable, and towels and linen were changed daily. The airconditioning we were supposed to get according to the reservation wasn't to see. The staff didn't seem to bother when we told them. Neither did we because the (outside) temperature was comfortable. Last, but not least, the location is perfect! Compared to what you have to pay for a more descent room at central Manhattan, this is a reasonable deal (we payed $124 pr. night taxes included - we couldn't find any other available room south of Central Park for under $200 tax. incl.). In other words; you get what you pay for - not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0veNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We didn't have problem at all. We stayed in a room with shared bathroom, I was a little worried about this before get there, but for our surprise the bathroom was always very clean and we never had to wait. There are 3 bathrooms at each floor. One bathroom very good and roomy and two bathrooms very small, but the big one was always available. The room had a big color TV (with cable! And it did work!!), a sink and a fridge, so that we could feel comfortable. We had been in New York City before and stayed in a hostel. Our experience in a hostel was not good and we paid more to stay there than we paid at the Seton Hotel, where we had a great time and more privacy. Another think we loved it about this place was the location. It's very close from the grand central, where we can take buses and metro and we could walk to the broadway and port authority as well, but we'd rather take a bus. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend!! Very clean and cozy!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL FOR THE BUDGET!”
Reviews.Author: ricagads
Reviews.Content: It's our first time to be in New York, but knowing New York w/c is known to be very expensive, I really looked for a hotel w/c wont take all of our budget away to enjoy the big apple; when i saw all the reviews-majority were horrible...but no turning back because I already have the reservation even before i saw the reviews...(i was the one who made the reservation) ..here comes the day of our arrival...i gave my husband a "head-up" on what to expect according to the reviews BUT, im telling you, the hotel is a GREAT DEAL- the staff were courteous, yes, the amenities are old and outdated but it's clean ( linens and BR are cleaned daily); the hotel is accessible and convenient to all (few blocks away from the "attractions"; we check-out @ 11AM but we left our luggage and got it @ 7PM (the hotel has a luggage room keeper); if Im going back to New York, i will still go back to Seton-well, when you're in New York, you only sleep and take shower in the room so Seton Hotel is a GREAT DEAL.

Reviews.Title: “A PLEASANT SURPRISE”
Reviews.Author: SharonMoore
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews about the Seton Hotel we were quite apprehensive . When we saw the very small reception area and narrow corridors we became worried. What a pleasant surprise when we entered the Queen room, it wasnt enormous but New York doesnt do enormous rooms! ample size for 2, bathroom was very modern and clean, small fridge and coffee maker perfect. Room was extremely hot !! but that was easily rectified. Only slight problem was the length of time it took for the shower to run hot but when it did the shower was great. Staff were very polite and helpful. We felt very safe as there was a door between the reception area and the access to the rooms which was kept locked from early evening. Our bedding and towels were changed every day!! room was very clean. We would most certainly go back, it was excellent value for money and the location was brilliant !!! Give it a go if you want a comfortable base to explore New York from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and NYC Experience”
Reviews.Author: southwest-com
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location - two blocks from Grand Central Station, with the NYC Subway we went all over the city. Booked the property for the price - an awesome price for New Years Eve! Room was clean, the furniture was worn - there were no bathroom issues - got in and out as needed. We had a double room (single bed) with the shared facilities. I would do this one again! On the second day we had another couple in the room next to us and you could hear their TV. Ohh yea the TV - it was one that I remember as a kid, this one had a remote control - it was full color and worked well - we had cable - I was impressed with that for some reason.... A little secret - no need to use the elevator (it is slow) their is a set of stairs at the end of the hallway. Staff was polite - they buzz you in at night so it is secure. Starbucks on the corner! This property reminds me of an old NYC apartment building they converted to a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe for women travellers”
Reviews.Author: Upekha
Reviews.Content: I booked online, but when I arrived I decided not to stay. The room smelled very bad, and the Yale lock was very loose. I did not feel that I would be safe - the room could easily be broken into - or that my belongings would be safe. In fairness, the hotel refunded my payment in full. The area seemed fine, but solo women travellers should think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: drole_d_ange
Reviews.Content: The location was really good and central, and the neighborhood seemed safe enough. The hotel had no charm at all but it was functional. It was reasonably clean although the furniture looked a bit worn out. The bathroom was ok too, except that we didn't always have hot water on the spot, but I hear it's not unusual in New York. I stayed there with my sister and we booked a private double/double room, which meant that we had our own bathroom. They say on the website that these rooms are meant for up to 4 people, but the beds were quite narrow so unless you're very much in love with your bedmate take one bed per person!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After the reviews we read we were worried but all for nothing. Not a 5 star for sure but certainly didnt expect that either. Small room but had a frig and a good tv and air conditioner. Room was clean and bathroom had been remodeled and was very clean. Rooms were cleaned every day including weekends(we read here that they were not on weekends) You did turn your key in when leaving which seemed a little odd but what did it matter? We felt very safe day and night and you are two blocks from Grand Central. The day before we left they delivered a truckload of new mattresses and other furniture all of which looked very nice. If you are looking for a good(great) price and not planning on making the room your trip why pay more? Its not for everyone, I admit but it suited us fine.
